11/3: Hal with his "little buddies" (Kent Blott, Idris Arslanian, Ingersol). He convinces them that their resentment of Schtitt is engineered by Schtitt and his staff. Switches to John (NR) Wayne, Troelsch, Struck, and Stice, each with his group of younger students.Ê
Mid-Oct.: "Mario Incandenza's First and Only Even Remotely Romantic Experience, Thus Far." It is indeed only remote, with the "USS" Millicent Kent

column4: YEAR OF DAIRY PRODUCTS FROM THE AMERICAN HEARTLAND
column5: Excerpt from a letter to State Farm detailing a bricklayer's bizarre accident. This is perhaps Wallace's most obvious example of borrowing from urban myths.Ê
Hal's seventh-grade essay comparing "Hawaii-Five-O"'s Steve McGarrett with "Hill Street Blues"'s Frank Furillo. The latter is a post-modern, more complicated, and perhaps too mild hero.
8/10: "Helen" Steeply'sÊMomentÊarticle about a woman who carried her artificial heart in her purse. She was mugged... [Poor Tony was the purse snatcher.]Ê
Alphabetic list of anti-ONAN groups.
Why Videophony didn't work
10/15: Urine tests at ETA, Pemulis sells clean samples
James Incandenza's father narrates, addressing 10 yr old Jim. Discusses Marlon Brando, tennis, and his own father's reaction when he blew out his knee at a match.Ê
11/4: Pemulis scores some DMZ (Madame Psychosis).Ê
Hal's narration ofÊTennis and the Feral Prodigy, a film by Mario Incandenza
11/5: Selected transcripts from Patricia Montesian's Log at Ennet House. Voices of recovering drug and alcohol abusers.

Late Oct: at WYYY, Sixty Minutes More or Less with Madame Psychosis, is about to go on. The late shift engineer goes to the roof to drink a Millennial Fizzy and listen top the show. Mario, with Hal at HmH, listens to the show.
Description of Unit #'s 1-7 of Ennet House
11/6: Freer and Kornspan work out while Rader consults with Lyle. Pemulis eavesdrops.
More detailed introduction to Ennet House and its residents. Tiny Ewell's obsession with tattoos.

Michael Pemulis explains that he has scored some DMZ, the "Yale U. of the Ivy League of Acid" from some Canadian insurgents. The boys decide to plan on taking it the weekend before the WhataBurger Invitational, 11/20-21Ê
11/7: Joelle Van Dyne, star of Jim Incandenza's movies, goes to Molly Notkin's MA thesis party.Ê
Chronology of Subsidized Time
Joelle thinks about Orin and his father, the "world's best hailer of Boston cabs."
Helen P. Steeply's (Putative) Curriculum Vitae
Joelle attempts to overdose in the bathroom at a party of cinema graduate students
Geographical description of Enfield, MA

11/5: Hal and Orin on the telephone. Now Orin wants to discuss Himself's suicide. (He put his head in a microwave.) Meanwhile, Hal is clipping his toenails and making miraculous shots into the wastepaper basket.

11/6: Tennis meet at Port Washington Tennis Academy, Long Island, NY. Descriptions of Hal and John ("No Relation") Wayne playing their respective games. Pemulis gets sick Schacht plays a French-Canadian.
Gately (substance-free for 421 days) is now staff Ennet House. Geoffrey Day, Charlotte Treat, Randy Lenz all appear.
ETA returns from Long Island Triumphant
The story of Orin and Joelle, the Prettiest Girl of All Time (PGOAT). His switch from tennis to football in college.
11/14: Poor Tony goes through withdrawal in the bathroom stall of a Boston public library.

11/6: description of ETA's Saturday academic classes. Ex.: Mary Esther Thode's "The Personal is the Political is the pathological." Ex. of an exam on psychopathological double-binds. Troelsch's broadcast of the morning's games on WETA (ETA's intercom). Hal is in Theirry Poutrincourt's class on Canadian political history. Some details of anti-ONAN activity (large mirrors across highways)Ê
Mario's surprise birth, and a description of some of his deformaties.
4/30-5/1: Maranthe and Steeply continued.
11/8: Interdependence Day. A game of Eschaton.

11/8: Boston AA meeting. Description of several speakers, (a "fifty year old immigrant" waxes eloquently about his first solid bowel movement in years) and the "crocodiles." Gately is curious about new girl Joelle.
The Statue of Liberty's product is changed every Jan 1.
Boston AA meeting. A young girl describes her foster father sexually abusing her paraplegic stepsister...Ê

11/8: Lyle tells Ortho "The Darkness" Stice, "Do not underestimate objects." Stice's bed has been moving at night.
11/8: Hal watching Mario's film. Description of Himself'sÊThe Medusa vs. the OdalisqueÊandÊTHE JOKE.

11/8: Continuation of Mario's film, with more headlines and a puppet show of Gentle and Rodney Tine, Chief, US Office of Unspecified Services. The story of legendary tennis player Eric Clipperton and his Glock 17 semiautomatic.

11/13: Kate Gompert, Geoffrey Day, and Bruce Green late-night rap session. Day describes the "large, dark, billowing, black shape" he's felt twice in his life.

11/11: The match between Stice and Hal. Narrrative "clicks" to scan Gatley, Poor Tony, Pemulis and Struck, Steeply's sedan, CT, and even Orin in AZ. Steeply chats with Aubrey deLint as they watch the match.Ê
Epistolary exchange between Steeply and Marlon Bain, friend of Orin's during adolescence.Ê
